enable.description: Master enable of TF module. When this variable is 0, all passes are disabled irrespective of en parameters. When this variable is 1, the enable of each pass is controlled by its en parameter.

blending_mode.description: 0 = regular blending. 1 = copy IMG to TFO. 2 = copy ANRO to TFO. 3 = copy MCTFP to TFO. 4 = use blending with constant factor between ANRO and MCTFP (this mode can not be used only when both inputs are available to TF).
blending_mode.additional_notes: Hide in GUI ! Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

is_anr_strength_blender_mode.description: Whether to use TF unit as a strength blender for ANR. When 1 or 2 the TF is used as ANR post-processing block and can not be used for temporal noise reduction. Usually used in still processing or MFNR Post. 0 - use regular mode for Temporal Filtering. 1 - use as strength blender for ANR according to the anr_final_blender parameters. (Basic mode). 2 - use as strength blender for ANR according to regular TF parameters and not based on anr_final_blender parameters. (Advanced mode) (Example: Use this mode if one wants to blend as a function of brighness or as a function of LNR).
is_anr_strength_blender_mode.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

disable_luma_ghost_detection.description: Whether ghost detection takes Luma into account. When both disable_luma_ghost_detection and disable_chroma_ghost_detection are 1, ghost detection is bypassed. (setting filter strength either to indication values or to zeros – depending on indications_affect_fs_decision_also_directly flag).
disable_luma_ghost_detection.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

disable_chroma_ghost_detection.description: Whether ghost detection takes Chroma into account. When both disable_luma_ghost_detection and disable_chroma_ghost_detection are 1, ghost detection is bypassed. (setting filter strength either to indication values or to zeros – depending on indications_affect_fs_decision_also_directly flag).
disable_chroma_ghost_detection.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

enable_lnr.description: Whether to enable radial update of noise thresholds (due to lens roll-off).
enable_lnr.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

noise_params_y_uv_limit.description: Limit for chroma values that affect Luma noise threshold.
noise_params_y_uv_limit.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

noise_params_cb_uv_limit.description: Limit for chroma values that affect Cb noise threshold.
noise_params_cb_uv_limit.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

noise_params_cr_uv_limit.description: Limit for chroma values that affect Cr noise threshold.
noise_params_cr_uv_limit.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

use_anr_for_decisions_y.description: Whether to use spatially filtered Luma for ghost detection decisions instead of unfiltered Luma.
use_anr_for_decisions_y.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

use_anr_for_decisions_c.description: Whether to use spatially filtered Chroma for ghost detection decisions instead of unfiltered Chroma.
use_anr_for_decisions_c.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

enable_noise_est_by_luma.description: Enables dependence of noise thresholds on luma. (0 for power-saving mode: all noise thresholds will depend only on chroma; if enable_noise_est_by_chroma is also 0 – noise thresholds will be constant). CONSTRAINT: When disable_luma_ghost_detection is 1, enable_noise_est_by_luma should be 0.
enable_noise_est_by_luma.additional_notes: Hide in GUI ! Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

enable_noise_est_by_chroma.description: Enables dependence of noise thresholds on chroma. (0 for power-saving mode: noise thresholds will depend only on luma; if enable_noise_est_by_luma is also 0 – noise thresholds will be constant). CONSTRAINT: When disable_chroma_ghost_detection is 1, enable_noise_est_by_chroma should be 0.
enable_noise_est_by_chroma.additional_notes: Hide in GUI ! Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

padding_by_reflection_override.description: 0 = Flow (i.e. SW) decisions may override chromatix value of padding_by_reflection, 1 = Chromatix value of padding_by_reflection is used irrespective of flow decisions.
padding_by_reflection_override.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

padding_by_reflection.description: Whether the padding in Luma anti-aliasing and SAD filters, is by reflection. When this flag is 0 (this is the default value) the padding is done by duplication of the boundary pixel. When this flag is 1 the padding is done by taking the value at a coordinate mirrored relative to the boundary.
padding_by_reflection.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

morph_erode_en.description: Enable morphological erode filter of indications (located before morphological dilate filter).
morph_erode_en.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

morph_dilate_en.description: Enable morphological dilate filter of indications (located after morphological erode filter).
morph_dilate_en.additional_notes: Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

smear_inputs_for_decisions.description: Determines whether to perform anti-aliasing (low pass) filter on Luma of the difference image prior to using it in ghost detection. When this flag is 1, blending sub-module will be forced to bypass one of inputs to TFO. (thus, anti-aliasing should be enabled only in low resolutions).
smear_inputs_for_decisions.additional_notes: Hide in GUI ! Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

indications_premultiply_factor.description: Multiplicative factor for decreasing the indication values (valid factor range is [0-16]). Value of 16 means no change to indications.
indications_premultiply_factor.additional_notes: Hide in GUI ! Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

invert_temporal_blending_weights.description: Whether to take 1-a instead of a for a1 and a4 blending weights.
invert_temporal_blending_weights.additional_notes: Hide in GUI ! Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

blending_mode.description: 0 = regular blending. 1 = copy IMG to TFO. 2 = copy ANRO to TFO. 3 = copy MCTFP to TFO. 4 = use blending with constant factor between ANRO and MCTFP (this mode can not be used only when both inputs are available to TF).
blending_mode.additional_notes: Hide in GUI ! Constant (per pass): no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

en.description: Enable of TF module (including upscaler) per pass. When 0, ANR image is forwarded to TF output.
en.additional_notes: Linear Ceil Interpolation: Do Linear Interpolation and then Ceil.

noise_params_y_ytb_tab.description: Contribution of luma to Y noise threshold, sampled at 17 points.

noise_params_y_ctb_tab.description: Contribution of chroma to Y noise threshold, specified for 8 extreme points.

noise_params_y_top_lim.description: Upper limit of Luma noise threshold.

noise_params_y_bot_lim.description: Lower limit of luma noise threshold.

noise_params_cb_ytb_tab.description: Contribution of luma to Cb noise threshold, sampled at 17 points.

noise_params_cb_ctb_tab.description: Contribution of chroma to Cb noise threshold, specified for 8 extreme points.

noise_params_cb_top_lim.description: Upper limit of Cb noise threshold.

noise_params_cb_bot_lim.description: Lower limit of Cb noise threshold.

noise_params_cr_ytb_tab.description: Contribution of luma to Cr noise threshold, sampled at 17 points.

noise_params_cr_ctb_tab.description: Contribution of chroma to Cr noise threshold, specified for 8 extreme points.

noise_params_cr_top_lim.description: Upper limit of Cr noise threshold.

noise_params_cr_bot_lim.description: Lower limit of Cr noise threshold.

a2_max_y.description: Upper limit for a2 blending factor calculation (used in case FS=0) in Luma.

a2_min_y.description: Lower limit for a2 blending factor calculation in Luma (this value may never be reached if a2_slope_y is too small).

a2_slope_y.description: a2 slope as a function of FS (a2 starts from a2_max_y at FS=0 and goes down with slope a2_slope_y as FS increases). Used for Luma.

a2_max_c.description: Upper limit for a2 blending factor calculation (used in case FS=0) in Chroma.

a2_min_c.description: Lower limit for a2 blending factor calculation in Chroma (this value may never be reached if a2_slope_c is too small).

a2_slope_c.description: a2 slope as a function of FS (a2 starts from a2_max_c at FS=0 and goes down with slope a2_slope_c as FS increases). Used for Chroma.

is_same_blending_for_all_frequencies.description: Forces same blending factor both for low and for high frequencies during blending.
is_same_blending_for_all_frequencies.additional_notes: Linear Floor Interpolation: Do Linear Interpolation and then Floor.

fs_to_a1_map_y_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a1 blending factor for Luma.

fs_to_a1_map_c_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a1 blending factor for Chroma.

fs_to_a4_map_y_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a4 blending factor for Luma.

fs_to_a4_map_c_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a4 blending factor for Chroma.

dither_y.description: Whether to apply dithering to Y channel of final TF output.
dither_y.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

dither_cb.description: Whether to apply dithering to Cb channel of final TF output.
dither_cb.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

dither_cr.description: Whether to apply dithering to Cr channel of final TF output.
dither_cr.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

lnr_lut_y_tab.description: The LUT of scale factors to be applied to Luma noise thresholds (this LUT is accessed by normalized distance to optical center).

lnr_lut_c_tab.description: The LUT of scale factors to be applied to Chroma noise thresholds (this LUT is accessed by normalized distance to optical center).

lnr_opt_center_x.description: Optical center coordinate (Q15) in virtual coordinate system of [0,1]x[0,1].

lnr_opt_center_y.description: Optical center coordinate (Q15) in virtual coordinate system of [0,1]x[0,1].

lnr_ellipses_bounding_rect_w.description: Defines the minimal bounding rectangle of LNR geometry (in virtual coordinate system of [0,1]x[0,1]). LNR gains are defined on uniformly sampled ellipses around the optical center, with lnr_ellipse_bounding_rect being the minimal bounding rectangle of the biggest ellipse. CONSTRAINT: the whole [0,1]x[0,1] image should be fully contained in the rectangle twice bigger than lnr_ellipse_bounding_rect.

lnr_ellipses_bounding_rect_h.description: Defines the minimal bounding rectangle of LNR geometry (in virtual coordinate system of [0,1]x[0,1]). LNR gains are defined on uniformly sampled ellipses around the optical center, with lnr_ellipse_bounding_rect being the minimal bounding rectangle of the biggest ellipse. CONSTRAINT: the whole [0,1]x[0,1] image should be fully contained in the rectangle twice bigger than lnr_ellipse_bounding_rect.

fs_decision_params_y_c1_tab.description: Multiplication factor used in Luma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold).

fs_decision_params_y_c2_tab.description: Offset used in Luma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold.

fs_decision_params_y_c3_tab.description: Multiplication factor used in Luma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold).

fs_decision_params_y_c4_tab.description: Offset used in Luma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold .

fs_decision_params_oof_y_c1.description: Multiplication factor used in Luma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold). Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_y_c2.description: Offset used in Luma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold. Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_y_c3.description: Multiplication factor used in Luma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold). Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_y_c4.description: Offset used in Luma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold. Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_c_c1_tab.description: Multiplication factor used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold) .

fs_decision_params_c_c2_tab.description: Offset used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold.

fs_decision_params_c_c3_tab.description: Multiplication factor used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold).

fs_decision_params_c_c4_tab.description: Offset used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold.

fs_decision_params_oof_c_c1.description: Multiplication factor used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold). Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_c_c2.description: Offset used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold. Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_c_c3.description: Multiplication factor used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold). Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_c_c4.description: Offset used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold. Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

apply_fs_rank_filter.description: Whether to apply peak removal on the FS image (i.e. on the result of FS decision).
apply_fs_rank_filter.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

apply_fs_lpf.description: Whether to apply low pass filter on the FS image (i.e. on the result of FS decision).
apply_fs_lpf.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

sad_y_calc_mode.description: Window size for SAD Y calculation. 0 = 7x5 window, 1 = 5x5 window, 2 = 3x3 window, 3 = 1x1 window.
sad_y_calc_mode.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

sad_c_calc_mode.description: Window size for SAD Cb and Cr calculations. 0 = 3x3 window, 1 = 5x3 window.
sad_c_calc_mode.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

use_indications.description: Whether to use indications from lower resolutions (should be 0 for lowest resolution pass where there is no indications input).
use_indications.additional_notes: Linear Ceil Interpolation: Do Linear Interpolation and then Ceil.

indications_affect_fs_decision_also_dire.description: When this flag is 1, indications affect FS decision also directly, by taking minimum of normal FS decision (i.e. at current resolution). and the indications value converted to 6 bits (i.e. from lower resolution; for out of frame pixels the indication value is clipped to out_of_frame_pixels_confidence before conversion). Evidently, in this mode, if ghost detection is disabled (by setting both disable_luma_ghost_detection and disable_chroma_ghost_detection to 1), normal FS decisions are ignored and only indications affect the FS decision. CONSTRAINT: Can be 1 only when use_indications is 1.
indications_affect_fs_decision_also_dire.additional_notes: Linear Ceil Interpolation: Do Linear Interpolation and then Ceil.

morph_erode_size.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

morph_dilate_size.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

tr_enable.description: Whether to enable warping transform refinement.
tr_enable.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

tr_block_num_x.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

tr_block_num_y.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

tr_fs_threshold.description: Minimal FS to contribute to transform refinement.

tr_dead_zone.description: Dead-zone for transform refinement results. 0 is equivalent to no dead-zone.

tr_count_percentage_threshold.description: Minimal percentage of good samples in a block to make its refinement valid.
tr_count_percentage_threshold.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

out_of_frame_pixels_confidence.description: When indications_affect_fs_decision_also_directly is 1, this value is used to update the indications in out of frame regions (i.e. pixels going out of frame during global motion compensation) - as upper limit .

is_dci_mode.description: Whether TF is working in DCI mode – in this mode fs_to_a4_maps are not used.
is_dci_mode.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

a3_t1_scale_y.description: Multiplication factor used for determining weak Luma threshold for a3 (based on weak decision threshold for FS).

a3_t1_offs_y.description: Offset used for determining weak Luma threshold for a3 (based on weak decision threshold for FS).

a3_t2_scale_y.description: Multiplication factor used for determining strong Luma threshold for a3 (based on strong decision threshold for FS).

a3_t2_offs_y.description: Offset used for determining strong Luma threshold for a3 (based on strong decision threshold for FS).

a3_t1_scale_c.description: Multiplication factor used for determining weak Chroma threshold for a3 (based on weak decision threshold for FS).

a3_t1_offs_c.description: Offset used for determining weak Chroma threshold for a3 (based on weak decision threshold for FS).

a3_t2_scale_c.description: Multiplication factor used for determining strong Chroma threshold for a3 (based on strong decision threshold for FS).

a3_t2_offs_c.description: Offset used for determining strong Chroma threshold for a3 (based on strong decision threshold for FS).

constant_blending_factor_y.description: Blending factor for Luma channel in case of constant blending mode.

constant_blending_factor_c.description: Blending factor for Chroma channels in case of constant blending mode.

video_first_frame_spatial_nr_percentage.description: In video flow, in first frame: the spatial NR is configured somewhere between a2_max and a2_min. This parameter defines the linearly increasing percentage: 0 =is greater than a2_min, 100 =is greater than a2_max.

scene_cut_recovery_time.description: Affects the algorithm of faster convergence in case of scene cut. When detectable scene-cut (e.g. exposure change) happens, TF will usually significantly decrease temporal filtering. In such case temporal weights should be kept small for some time to allow faster temporal noise convergence. This parameter defines the allowed period in which the temporal weights should return to normal weights. When 0 - scene cut recovery is disabled. When 128 - default algorithm behavior is used. When 255 - slowest recovery (according to the algorithm) will be used.

anr_final_blender_luma_min_strength_high.description: Controls adaptive blending of ANR output with ANR input for High Frequencies of Luma (see description of anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_low parameter for details). Effective strength = 0 means taking only ANR input. Effective strength = 256 means taking only ANR output.

anr_final_blender_luma_min_strength_low_.description: Controls adaptive blending of ANR output with ANR input for Low Frequencies of Luma (see description of anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_low parameter for details). Effective strength = 0 means taking only ANR input. Effective strength = 256 means taking only ANR output.

anr_final_blender_chroma_min_strength_hi.description: Controls adaptive blending of ANR output with ANR input for High Frequencies of Chroma (see description of anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_low parameter for details). Effective strength = 0 means taking only ANR input. Effective strength = 256 means taking only ANR output.

anr_final_blender_chroma_min_strength_lo.description: Controls adaptive blending of ANR output with ANR input for Low Frequencies of Chroma (see description of anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_low parameter for details). Effective strength = 0 means taking only ANR input. Effective strength = 256 means taking only ANR output.

anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr.description: Strength decision is based on dissimilarity decision between ANR input and ANR output. Similar pixels will get strength=0, dissimilar pixels will get strength = 256; in-between, linear interpolation is used. Similarity is calculated as min(Similarity_Y, Similarity_Cb, Similarity_Cr). If ABS(ANR_Y_IN-ANR_Y_OUT) is less than anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_low, then Similarity_Y = max;. if ABS(ANR_Y_IN-ANR_Y_OUT) is greater or equal than anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_high, then Similarity_Y = min;. otherwise, linear interpolation is used. And similarly for Cb and Cr (using cthr values): e.g. if ABS(ANR_Cb_IN-ANR_Cb_OUT) is less than anr_final_blender_strength_decision_cthr_low, then Similarity_Cb = max;. if ABS(ANR_Cb_IN-ANR_Cb_OUT) is greater or equal than anr_final_blender_strength_decision_cthr_high, then Similarity_Cb = min;. otherwise, linear interpolation is used. This feature is designed to prevent peak noises back to the final image.

en.description: Enable of TF module (including upscaler) per pass. When 0, ANR image is forwarded to TF output.
en.additional_notes: Linear Ceil Interpolation: Do Linear Interpolation and then Ceil.

noise_params_y_ytb_tab.description: Contribution of luma to Y noise threshold, sampled at 17 points.

noise_params_y_ctb_tab.description: Contribution of chroma to Y noise threshold, specified for 8 extreme points.

noise_params_y_top_lim.description: Upper limit of Luma noise threshold.

noise_params_y_bot_lim.description: Lower limit of luma noise threshold.

noise_params_cb_ytb_tab.description: Contribution of luma to Cb noise threshold, sampled at 17 points.

noise_params_cb_ctb_tab.description: Contribution of chroma to Cb noise threshold, specified for 8 extreme points.

noise_params_cb_top_lim.description: Upper limit of Cb noise threshold.

noise_params_cb_bot_lim.description: Lower limit of Cb noise threshold.

noise_params_cr_ytb_tab.description: Contribution of luma to Cr noise threshold, sampled at 17 points.

noise_params_cr_ctb_tab.description: Contribution of chroma to Cr noise threshold, specified for 8 extreme points.

noise_params_cr_top_lim.description: Upper limit of Cr noise threshold.

noise_params_cr_bot_lim.description: Lower limit of Cr noise threshold.

a2_max_y.description: Upper limit for a2 blending factor calculation (used in case FS=0) in Luma.

a2_min_y.description: Lower limit for a2 blending factor calculation in Luma (this value may never be reached if a2_slope_y is too small).

a2_slope_y.description: a2 slope as a function of FS (a2 starts from a2_max_y at FS=0 and goes down with slope a2_slope_y as FS increases). Used for Luma.

a2_max_c.description: Upper limit for a2 blending factor calculation (used in case FS=0) in Chroma.

a2_min_c.description: Lower limit for a2 blending factor calculation in Chroma (this value may never be reached if a2_slope_c is too small).

a2_slope_c.description: a2 slope as a function of FS (a2 starts from a2_max_c at FS=0 and goes down with slope a2_slope_c as FS increases). Used for Chroma.

is_same_blending_for_all_frequencies.description: Forces same blending factor both for low and for high frequencies during blending.
is_same_blending_for_all_frequencies.additional_notes: Linear Floor Interpolation: Do Linear Interpolation and then Floor.

fs_to_a1_map_y_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a1 blending factor for Luma.

fs_to_a1_map_c_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a1 blending factor for Chroma.

fs_to_a4_map_y_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a4 blending factor for Luma.

fs_to_a4_map_c_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a4 blending factor for Chroma.

dither_y.description: Whether to apply dithering to Y channel of final TF output.

dither_cb.description: Whether to apply dithering to Cb channel of final TF output.
dither_cb.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

dither_cr.description: Whether to apply dithering to Cr channel of final TF output.
dither_cr.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

lnr_lut_c_tab.description: The LUT of scale factors to be applied to Chroma noise thresholds (this LUT is accessed by normalized distance to optical center).

lnr_opt_center_x.description: Optical center coordinate (Q15) in virtual coordinate system of [0,1]x[0,1].

lnr_opt_center_y.description: Optical center coordinate (Q15) in virtual coordinate system of [0,1]x[0,1].

lnr_ellipses_bounding_rect_w.description: Defines the minimal bounding rectangle of LNR geometry (in virtual coordinate system of [0,1]x[0,1]). LNR gains are defined on uniformly sampled ellipses around the optical center, with lnr_ellipse_bounding_rect being the minimal bounding rectangle of the biggest ellipse. CONSTRAINT: the whole [0,1]x[0,1] image should be fully contained in the rectangle twice bigger than lnr_ellipse_bounding_rect.

lnr_ellipses_bounding_rect_h.description: Defines the minimal bounding rectangle of LNR geometry (in virtual coordinate system of [0,1]x[0,1]). LNR gains are defined on uniformly sampled ellipses around the optical center, with lnr_ellipse_bounding_rect being the minimal bounding rectangle of the biggest ellipse. CONSTRAINT: the whole [0,1]x[0,1] image should be fully contained in the rectangle twice bigger than lnr_ellipse_bounding_rect.

fs_decision_params_y_c1_tab.description: Multiplication factor used in Luma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold).

fs_decision_params_y_c2_tab.description: Offset used in Luma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold.

fs_decision_params_y_c3_tab.description: Multiplication factor used in Luma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold).

fs_decision_params_y_c4_tab.description: Offset used in Luma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold .

fs_decision_params_oof_y_c1.description: Multiplication factor used in Luma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold). Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_y_c2.description: Offset used in Luma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold. Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_y_c3.description: Multiplication factor used in Luma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold). Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_y_c4.description: Offset used in Luma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold. Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_c_c1_tab.description: Multiplication factor used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold) .

fs_decision_params_c_c2_tab.description: Offset used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold.

fs_decision_params_c_c3_tab.description: Multiplication factor used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold).

fs_decision_params_c_c4_tab.description: Offset used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold.

fs_decision_params_oof_c_c1.description: Multiplication factor used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold). Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_c_c2.description: Offset used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form weak threshold. Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_c_c3.description: Multiplication factor used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold (multiplies basic noise threshold). Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

fs_decision_params_oof_c_c4.description: Offset used in Chroma thresholds calculation to form strong threshold. Used in case of out-of-frame Luma pixel.

apply_fs_rank_filter.description: Whether to apply peak removal on the FS image (i.e. on the result of FS decision).
apply_fs_rank_filter.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

apply_fs_lpf.description: Whether to apply low pass filter on the FS image (i.e. on the result of FS decision).
apply_fs_lpf.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

sad_y_calc_mode.description: Window size for SAD Y calculation. 0 = 7x5 window, 1 = 5x5 window, 2 = 3x3 window, 3 = 1x1 window.
sad_y_calc_mode.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

sad_c_calc_mode.description: Window size for SAD Cb and Cr calculations. 0 = 3x3 window, 1 = 5x3 window.
sad_c_calc_mode.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

use_indications.description: Whether to use indications from lower resolutions (should be 0 for lowest resolution pass where there is no indications input).
use_indications.additional_notes: Linear Ceil Interpolation: Do Linear Interpolation and then Ceil.

indications_affect_fs_decision_also_dire.description: When this flag is 1, indications affect FS decision also directly, by taking minimum of normal FS decision (i.e. at current resolution). and the indications value converted to 6 bits (i.e. from lower resolution; for out of frame pixels the indication value is clipped to out_of_frame_pixels_confidence before conversion). Evidently, in this mode, if ghost detection is disabled (by setting both disable_luma_ghost_detection and disable_chroma_ghost_detection to 1), normal FS decisions are ignored and only indications affect the FS decision. CONSTRAINT: Can be 1 only when use_indications is 1.
indications_affect_fs_decision_also_dire.additional_notes: Linear Ceil Interpolation: Do Linear Interpolation and then Ceil.

morph_erode_size.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

morph_dilate_size.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

tr_enable.description: Whether to enable warping transform refinement.
tr_enable.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

tr_block_num_x.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

tr_block_num_y.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

tr_fs_threshold.description: Minimal FS to contribute to transform refinement.

tr_dead_zone.description: Dead-zone for transform refinement results. 0 is equivalent to no dead-zone.

tr_count_percentage_threshold.description: Minimal percentage of good samples in a block to make its refinement valid.
tr_count_percentage_threshold.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

out_of_frame_pixels_confidence.description: When indications_affect_fs_decision_also_directly is 1, this value is used to update the indications in out of frame regions (i.e. pixels going out of frame during global motion compensation) - as upper limit .

is_dci_mode.description: Whether TF is working in DCI mode – in this mode fs_to_a4_maps are not used.
is_dci_mode.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

a3_t1_scale_y.description: Multiplication factor used for determining weak Luma threshold for a3 (based on weak decision threshold for FS).

a3_t1_offs_y.description: Offset used for determining weak Luma threshold for a3 (based on weak decision threshold for FS).

a3_t2_scale_y.description: Multiplication factor used for determining strong Luma threshold for a3 (based on strong decision threshold for FS).

a3_t2_offs_y.description: Offset used for determining strong Luma threshold for a3 (based on strong decision threshold for FS).

a3_t1_scale_c.description: Multiplication factor used for determining weak Chroma threshold for a3 (based on weak decision threshold for FS).

a3_t1_offs_c.description: Offset used for determining weak Chroma threshold for a3 (based on weak decision threshold for FS).

a3_t2_scale_c.description: Multiplication factor used for determining strong Chroma threshold for a3 (based on strong decision threshold for FS).

a3_t2_offs_c.description: Offset used for determining strong Chroma threshold for a3 (based on strong decision threshold for FS).

constant_blending_factor_y.description: Blending factor for Luma channel in case of constant blending mode.

constant_blending_factor_c.description: Blending factor for Chroma channels in case of constant blending mode.

video_first_frame_spatial_nr_percentage.description: In video flow, in first frame: the spatial NR is configured somewhere between a2_max and a2_min. This parameter defines the linearly increasing percentage: 0 =is greater than a2_min, 100 =is greater than a2_max.

scene_cut_recovery_time.description: Affects the algorithm of faster convergence in case of scene cut. When detectable scene-cut (e.g. exposure change) happens, TF will usually significantly decrease temporal filtering. In such case temporal weights should be kept small for some time to allow faster temporal noise convergence. This parameter defines the allowed period in which the temporal weights should return to normal weights. When 0 - scene cut recovery is disabled. When 128 - default algorithm behavior is used. When 255 - slowest recovery (according to the algorithm) will be used.

anr_final_blender_luma_min_strength_high.description: Controls adaptive blending of ANR output with ANR input for High Frequencies of Luma (see description of anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_low parameter for details). Effective strength = 0 means taking only ANR input. Effective strength = 256 means taking only ANR output.

anr_final_blender_luma_min_strength_low_.description: Controls adaptive blending of ANR output with ANR input for Low Frequencies of Luma (see description of anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_low parameter for details). Effective strength = 0 means taking only ANR input. Effective strength = 256 means taking only ANR output.

anr_final_blender_chroma_min_strength_hi.description: Controls adaptive blending of ANR output with ANR input for High Frequencies of Chroma (see description of anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_low parameter for details). Effective strength = 0 means taking only ANR input. Effective strength = 256 means taking only ANR output.

anr_final_blender_chroma_min_strength_lo.description: Controls adaptive blending of ANR output with ANR input for Low Frequencies of Chroma (see description of anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_low parameter for details). Effective strength = 0 means taking only ANR input. Effective strength = 256 means taking only ANR output.

anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr.description: Strength decision is based on dissimilarity decision between ANR input and ANR output. Similar pixels will get strength=0, dissimilar pixels will get strength = 256; in-between, linear interpolation is used. Similarity is calculated as min(Similarity_Y, Similarity_Cb, Similarity_Cr). If ABS(ANR_Y_IN-ANR_Y_OUT) is less than anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_low, then Similarity_Y = max;. if ABS(ANR_Y_IN-ANR_Y_OUT) is greater or equal than anr_final_blender_strength_decision_ythr_high, then Similarity_Y = min;. otherwise, linear interpolation is used. And similarly for Cb and Cr (using cthr values): e.g. if ABS(ANR_Cb_IN-ANR_Cb_OUT) is less than anr_final_blender_strength_decision_cthr_low, then Similarity_Cb = max;. if ABS(ANR_Cb_IN-ANR_Cb_OUT) is greater or equal than anr_final_blender_strength_decision_cthr_high, then Similarity_Cb = min;. otherwise, linear interpolation is used. This feature is designed to prevent peak noises back to the final image.

en.description: Enable of TF module (including upscaler) per pass. When 0, ANR image is forwarded to TF output.
en.additional_notes: Linear Ceil Interpolation: Do Linear Interpolation and then Ceil.

noise_params_y_ytb_tab.description: Contribution of luma to Y noise threshold, sampled at 17 points.

noise_params_y_ctb_tab.description: Contribution of chroma to Y noise threshold, specified for 8 extreme points.

noise_params_y_top_lim.description: Upper limit of Luma noise threshold.

noise_params_y_bot_lim.description: Lower limit of luma noise threshold.

noise_params_cb_ytb_tab.description: Contribution of luma to Cb noise threshold, sampled at 17 points.

noise_params_cb_ctb_tab.description: Contribution of chroma to Cb noise threshold, specified for 8 extreme points.

noise_params_cb_top_lim.description: Upper limit of Cb noise threshold.

noise_params_cb_bot_lim.description: Lower limit of Cb noise threshold.

noise_params_cr_ytb_tab.description: Contribution of luma to Cr noise threshold, sampled at 17 points.

noise_params_cr_ctb_tab.description: Contribution of chroma to Cr noise threshold, specified for 8 extreme points.

noise_params_cr_top_lim.description: Upper limit of Cr noise threshold.

noise_params_cr_bot_lim.description: Lower limit of Cr noise threshold.

a2_max_y.description: Upper limit for a2 blending factor calculation (used in case FS=0) in Luma.

a2_min_y.description: Lower limit for a2 blending factor calculation in Luma (this value may never be reached if a2_slope_y is too small).

a2_slope_y.description: a2 slope as a function of FS (a2 starts from a2_max_y at FS=0 and goes down with slope a2_slope_y as FS increases). Used for Luma.

a2_max_c.description: Upper limit for a2 blending factor calculation (used in case FS=0) in Chroma.

a2_min_c.description: Lower limit for a2 blending factor calculation in Chroma (this value may never be reached if a2_slope_c is too small).

a2_slope_c.description: a2 slope as a function of FS (a2 starts from a2_max_c at FS=0 and goes down with slope a2_slope_c as FS increases). Used for Chroma.

is_same_blending_for_all_frequencies.description: Forces same blending factor both for low and for high frequencies during blending.
is_same_blending_for_all_frequencies.additional_notes: Linear Floor Interpolation: Do Linear Interpolation and then Floor.

fs_to_a1_map_y_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a1 blending factor for Luma.

fs_to_a1_map_c_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a1 blending factor for Chroma.

fs_to_a4_map_y_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a4 blending factor for Luma.

fs_to_a4_map_c_tab.description: Sparse mapping between FS values [0:8:64] and a4 blending factor for Chroma.

dither_y.description: Whether to apply dithering to Y channel of final TF output.
dither_y.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

dither_cb.description: Whether to apply dithering to Cb channel of final TF output.
dither_cb.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

dither_cr.description: Whether to apply dithering to Cr channel of final TF output.
dither_cr.additional_notes: Nearest neighbor interpolation: discrete values allowed.

lnr_lut_y_tab.description: The LUT of scale factors to be applied to Luma noise thresholds (this LUT is accessed by normalized distance to optical center).

lnr_lut_c_tab.description: The LUT of scale factors to be applied to Chroma noise thresholds (this LUT is accessed by normalized distance to optical center).

lnr_opt_center_x.description: Optical center coordinate (Q15) in virtual coordinate system of [0,1]x[0,1].

lnr_opt_center_y.description: Optical center coordinate (Q15) in virtual coordinate system of [0,1]x[0,1].

CONSTRAINT: the whole [0,1]x[0,1] image should be fully contained in the rectangle twice bigger than lnr_ellipse_bounding_rect.
